word: The apostle's heart was touched with sympathy as he beheld their sorrow. Then, directing that the weeping friends be sent from the room, he kneeled down and prayed fervently to God to restore  Dorcas to life and health. Turning to the body, he said, " Tabitha, arise. And she opened her eyes: and when she saw Peter, she sat up."  Dorcas had been of great service to the church, and God saw fit to bring her back from the land of the enemy.--AA 131, 132 (1911).
